Crypto News: Chair of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Gary Gensler on Thursday dodged the questions around the agency’s next step in response to judge Analisa Torres’ Summary Judgment in favor of Ripple in the XRP Vs SEC lawsuit. item.title: XRP Investment Funds See AUM Surge; Will XRP Climb To $1?
item.dc:creator: John Isige
item.description:
XRP, alongside Solana (SOL) and Stellar (XLM), has seen significant inflows in its assets under management (AUM), according to the latest CryptoCompare report. Investors have since the Ripple ruling, which deemed XRP not a security in secondary sales, like those on exchanges like Coinbase and Binance, focused less on Bitcoin (BTC) while concentrating on altcoins. Funds built around XRP

The post XRP Investment Funds See AUM Surge; Will XRP Climb To $1? appeared first on CoinGape.

item.title: Is Coinbase Integrating Bitcoin Lightning? Solana Better Than Lightning Network
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong urges the crypto community to work on making crypto payments instant and free globally. Bitcoin maximalists including Block co-founder Jack Dorsey, MicroStrategy executive chairman Michael Saylor, and others replied asking Coinbase to integrate Bitcoin Lightning Network on the exchange. However, Solana co-founder Anatoly Yakovenko argues Solana is faster and cheaper than

The post Is Coinbase Integrating Bitcoin Lightning? Solana Better Than Lightning Network appeared first on CoinGape.

item.title: Just-In: Hong Kong Central Bank Collaborates With Saudi Arabia After UAE Crypto Push
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Saudi Central Bank (SAMA) to strengthen financial collaboration. It follows the HKMA’s collaboration with the UAE central bank on May 30 to improve financial service sectors, as well as virtual asset regulations and developments. item.title: US Prosecutors Drop Charges on SBF For Illegal Campaign Contribution
item.dc:creator: Bhushan Akolkar
item.description:
On Wednesday, July 26, the US prosecutors stated that they would be dropping charges against disgraced FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried over unlawful campaign contributions. In a letter to the court on Wednesday, US Attorney Damian Williams wrote: “In keeping with its treaty obligations to The Bahamas, the government does not intend to proceed to trial
